Module paceManager
Package app

Class Settings

java.lang.Object
java.settings.SettingsDeprecated
public class Settings extends Object
Class containing all current settings of the program. Stores these values in a location dependent on the operating system. Or at least that is what it's supposed to do.
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Thomas Kwashnak

    • fileExtensions

      private String[] fileExtensions
      What the file extension should be for files opened by the program. Extensions are in the format .___
      Since:
      1.0.0
      Default
      [.pace, .json]

    • paceDirectory

      private String paceDirectory
      Default directory to begin looking for pace files in
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • Launcher
      Default
      User Documents directory

    • aggressiveSave

      private boolean aggressiveSave
      Determines if the file should be automatically saved every update
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • App.update()
      Default
      true

    • aggressiveMemorySave

      private boolean aggressiveMemorySave
      Determines if additional steps are taken to reduce memory used by the program.
      Since:
      1.0.0
      Default
      false

    • launcherMaximized

      private boolean launcherMaximized
      Determines whether the launcher should be initially maximized to the whole screen or as a small and movable window

      true if the launcher should be maximized, false otherwise

      Since:
      1.0.0
      Default
      false

    • appMaximized

      private boolean appMaximized
      Determines whether the application should be initially maximized to the whole screen or as a small and movable window

      true if the application should be maximized, false otherwise

      Since:
      1.0.0
      Default
      true

    • warnOnDelete

      private boolean warnOnDelete
      Determines if the application should warn the user first before deleting anything or to just delete it outright

      If set to true, will display a prompt to the user asking if they really want to delete whatever, and then if they verify that they wish to delete it, will continue with the process

      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • App.warnDelete(String)
      Default
      true

    • excludeOutliers

      private boolean excludeOutliers
      Determines if in calculations, the longest and the shortest team are not included in averaging
      Since:
      1.0.0
      Default
      true

    • useAverageAsGoalTime

      private boolean useAverageAsGoalTime
      Whether to default to the average if no goal-time is presented for a division
      Since:
      1.0.0
      Default
      true

    • multipleTeamsEditing

      private boolean multipleTeamsEditing
      Allows for multiple teams editing windows to be opened

  • Method Details

    • save

      public void save()
      Saves the current configuration
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • isAggressiveMemorySave

      public boolean isAggressiveMemorySave()
      Returns whether to aggressively save memory (ram)
      Returns:
      true if the settingDeprecated is set to true, false if the settingDeprecated is set to false
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • aggressiveMemorySave

    • setAggressiveMemorySave

      public void setAggressiveMemorySave(boolean value)
      Sets whether the program should be concerned about aggressively saving values

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      value - true if the program should take extra steps to reduce memory, false if not
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • aggressiveMemorySave

    • getFileExtensions

      public String[] getFileExtensions()
      Gets the list of file extensions used when opening a pace file
      Returns:
      String array of valid file extensions. Extensions are in the format .___.
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • fileExtensions

    • setFileExtensions

      public void setFileExtensions(String[] fileExtensions)
      Sets the list of file extensions.

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      fileExtensions - String array of valid file extensions. Extensions are in the format .___.
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • fileExtensions

    • setPaceDirectory

      public void setPaceDirectory(String directory)
      Sets the pace directory

      Since:

    • addRecentFile

      public void addRecentFile(String path)
      Adds a new recent file to the list of recent files if that file is not already listed

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      path - String Path representation of the new file to add
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • recentFiles

      • recentFiles

    • isAggressiveSave

      public boolean isAggressiveSave()
      Returns whether to aggressively save the pace file whenever a modification has been made to it
      Returns:
      true if a pace object should attempt to save whenever a modification ping is sent to it, false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • aggressiveSave

    • setAggressiveSave

      public void setAggressiveSave(boolean aggressiveSave)
      Sets whether to aggressively save the pace file whenever a modification has been made to it

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      aggressiveSave - true if a pace object should attempt to save whenever a modification ping is sent to it, false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      • aggressiveSave

    • isLauncherMaximized

      public boolean isLauncherMaximized()
      Returns whether the launcher should be opened maximized or in window mode
      Returns:
      true if the launcher should take up the whole screen, false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0.0
